div.l: Butte atte laste his Maystre hym biþoughte
Vppon A daye whan he his papre soughte
Of A prouerbe þat sayeþe this same worde
Well bette is rotten Appulle owte of horde
Than that itt rote All the remenawnte
So Farethe hitt by A Ryotous Saruᵃaunte
Itt is Fulle lasse harme to lette itt pace
Than he schende All þe Saruᵃauntes in þe place
Therefor his Maystre yafe hym Aquietāaunce
And badde hym go with Sorowe ⁊and Myschuᵃaunce
And þus this Iolye p̉rentyse hadde his leue
Now lette hym ryotte All þe nyghte or leue
For þ̉er nys no thefe withouten A louke
That helpethe hym to wasten ⁊and to souke
Of þat he brybe can or borowe maye
Anon̄e he sente his bedde ⁊and his Araye
Vnto a Cowper of his owne Sorte
That louede dyse Reuelle ⁊and disporte
And hadde a wyfe þat helde For countenᵃaunce
A schoppe and swyuede For her Sustynᵃaunce
Her endeth o tale of the Cooke

⁊and her folowyth a nother
tale of the same cooke
Lythen ⁊and lysteneþe ⁊and harkeneþe arighte
And ye schulud here of a doughty knyghte
Sir Iohn of Boundis was his name
He couþe of norture and mochell of game
Thre sones þe knyghte hadde with his bodye wan
The oldeste was a moche schrewe and soone he begonne
His broth̉erne louede wele her Fadre and of hym were agaste
The oldeste deseruede his Fadres curse and hadde hitt atte þe laste
The gode knyghte his Fadre lyuede so yore
That deþe was hym comen and handelede hym fulle sore
The gode knyghte carede sore syke þere he laye
